III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4505 Plans and specifications
Section (1) Plans and specifications shall be submitted to the bureau of fire
Description services for review and approval prior to any remodeling in an
institution, or the construction or conversion of a structure for use
as an institution.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility did not submit a plan for review prior to remodeling the
building even after they were directed to do so by licensing.
1

Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via phone on
1/11/24. CA reported he was not aware of the requirement for a
plan review prior to remodeling or construction of the facility. CA
reported Program Director did not provide him the information
after her being told by DCWL it needed to occur. CA reported
initially they did not believe it was going to be a whole house
renovation, so he believed that could have played a factor in the
miscommunication. CA reported he sent the information regarding
the requirement for a plan review to his Director of Maintenance
on 1/8/24.
Program Director could not be interviewed as she no longer
works at the facility.
Timeline of Events:
- 5/10/23: Received lab results via email from CA.
Contaminated areas of the facility were draped off so no
one could enter them.
- 5/15/23: Phone meeting with Program Director, Consultant
and Area Manager to discuss whole house renovations.
Area Manager discussed plan review process with Program
Director on this call.
- 8/7/23: Construction began at the facility.
DOCUMENTS:
- Email to CA on 1/8/24 to request the approved plan review.
CA reported he missed the document request and
requested Director of Maintenance get it done immediately.
- Email from Bureau of Fire Services Manager on 1/24/24
states “Repairs and maintenance of an existing
structure/structural components do not require a plan
review submittal. The repair/maintenance must be “like for
like” with the same materials and there are no additions,
alterations, remodeling, or upgrades to the facility”.
Analysis The violation is not established as it was learned on 1/24/24 a
plan review was not required for this specific project as the agency
was not altering any items on the home but just replacing the
items with the same item.
Technical Assistance:
Although this was not a violation as it was determined the agency
was not remodeling but replacing the same items, that information
was not known during the initial report when DCWL reminded the
2

agency to refer to the plan review process. At that time, the
agency was unaware if a plan review was required or not. Should
the agency encounter this again, they should inquire with the Fire
Bureau timely and not wait until 8 months to seek clarification on
the requirement.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
